channel.title: Jeff Atwood / @codinghorror
channel.description: Twitter feed for: @codinghorror. Generated by nitter.42l.fr

item.title: R to @mattdarveniza: it is, though -- assembling a system is kind of a pain, whereas here you can use the integrated GPU for simple games and attach any GPU/PSU if you want to go big. It's the console style of expansion, external plugin.
item.dc:creator: @codinghorror
item.description: it is, though -- assembling a system is kind of a pain, whereas here you can use the integrated GPU for simple games and attach any GPU/PSU if you want to go big. It's the console style of expansion, external plugin.

item.title:
RT by @codinghorror: "The Trump model, in other words, is more the South in 1850 than the South in 1950, more John Calhoun than Richard Russell."
Worth reading this whole unsettling piece to grasp the context for that sentence: https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2022/06/red-and-blue-state-divide-is-growing-michael-podhorzer-newsletter/661377/
item.dc:creator: @pomeranian99
item.description:
"The Trump model, in other words, is more the South in 1850 than the South in 1950, more John Calhoun than Richard Russell."

Worth reading this whole unsettling piece to grasp the context for that sentence: theatlantic.com/politics/arc‚Ä¶

item.title: R to @chia_pizza: how would you upgrade the GPU on your laptop?
item.dc:creator: @codinghorror
item.description: how would you upgrade the GPU on your laptop?

item.title: R to @keelanl: every single user page has a "download" button on it, for one thing. And Discourse sites mirror images in posts by default, plus bake in oneboxes for links. So, yes. It's designed to preserve history and make it searchable.
item.dc:creator: @codinghorror
item.description: every single user page has a "download" button on it, for one thing. And Discourse sites mirror images in posts by default, plus bake in oneboxes for links. So, yes. It's designed to preserve history and make it searchable.

item.title: R to @mattdarveniza: The GPU is all that matters. We have comical obscene amounts of CPU power, and consoles tend to have super weak x86 CPUs, meaning games are optimized for "who cares" on CPU and the maximum GPU you can afford. This config is *exactly that* which is cool!
item.dc:creator: @codinghorror
item.description: The GPU is all that matters. We have comical obscene amounts of CPU power, and consoles tend to have super weak x86 CPUs, meaning games are optimized for "who cares" on CPU and the maximum GPU you can afford. This config is *exactly that* which is cool!

item.title: R to @textfiles: well, we've been over here building @discourse for almost a decade now üåà .. and we're even adding real time chat so people can have their üç∞ and eat it, too.

item.title: R to @codinghorror: Perfect timing for the new era of cheap(er) GPUs -- combination of low crypto prices and lots of people upgrading to the upcoming 4000 series in July
item.dc:creator: @codinghorror
item.description: Perfect timing for the new era of cheap(er) GPUs -- combination of low crypto prices and lots of people upgrading to the upcoming 4000 series in July

item.title: RT by @codinghorror: EXCLUSIVE: I spoke with Medieval Times workers about why they want to unionize their castle. What they deal with is nuts: guests spooking the horses, grabbing the falcon, even putting their hands on the queen. They want better pay and safety -- and respect https://www.huffpost.com/entry/medieval-times-workers-first-union_n_62bb1d29e4b0d26a9b14fa17?mpi
item.dc:creator: @jamieson
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: I spoke with Medieval Times workers about why they want to unionize their castle. What they deal with is nuts: guests spooking the horses, grabbing the falcon, even putting their hands on the queen. They want better pay and safety -- and respect huffpost.com/entry/medieval-‚Ä¶

item.title: R to @codinghorror: The videogame part is a different story / industry, and the restriction on streaming apps is really dumb on Apple's part.
